intro: Gypsocallis pilosa, commonly known as the hairy gypsocallis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaryllis family (Amaryllidaceae) and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant features a bulbous stem and produces showy, often fragrant blooms during the warmer months. Its hairy leaves and robust growth make it a distinctive species within its genus. Gypsocallis pilosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
